text: Example 1 𝑌 𝑠 = 4 𝑠 + 50 𝑠2 + 30𝑠 + 200 𝑅(𝑠) The laser in a laser printer is positioned by a control input r(t), which represents the desired position of the laser beam. The actual position is given by: a) If r(t) is a unit step input, find the output y(t). b) What is the final steady state value of y(t)? Example 2 The block diagram of a control system is given in the figure below: a) Determine the transfer function T1(s) = Y(s)/R(s) b) Determine the transfer function T2(s) = Y(s)/D(s) 𝐾 𝑏 𝑠 + 1 Y(s)R(s) + - D(s) + - Example 3 Consider the closed loop system shown in the figure below: a) Determine the steady state transfer function T(s) = Y(s)/R(s) b) Define the tracking error to be E(s) = Y(s) – R(s). Calculate E(s) and determine the steady state tracking error due to a unit step input. [Hint: at steady-state, you may consider D(s) = 0] G 𝑠 = K 𝑠+10 𝐺(𝑠) Y(s)E(s)R(s) + - 𝐻(𝑠) D(s) + + H 𝑠 = 14 𝑠2+5𝑠+6
